SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of the allergen wheal size to the positive control wheal size in an allergen skin test.
A semi-quantitative assessment of the intensity of the wheal and flare reaction.
An indication as to whether blistering occurred.
The size of the area of redness that forms around the site of an antigenic challenge to the skin.
The longest diameter of the area of redness that forms around the site of an antigenic challenge to the skin.
The mean diameter of the area of redness that forms around the site of an antigenic challenge to the skin.
The longest diameter of an area of hardness in the skin. (NCI)

An act or process of elucidation; explication, or explanation of the meaning of the event or thing via the assignment of objects from the domain to the constants of a formal language, truth-values to the proposition symbols, truth-functions to the connectives, other functions to the function symbols, and extensions to the predicates, if any. The assignments are result of human logic application and are not native to the symbols of the formal language.
The position on a scale to assess the degree of the response to a stimulus or intervention.
A semi-quantitative size assessment of the flat, circular, slightly raised area that forms around the site of an antigenic challenge to the skin.
The process of evaluating the wheal diameter in response to an allergen, based on a threshold size.
The longest diameter of the flat, circular, slightly raised area that forms around the site of an antigenic challenge to the skin.
The mean diameter of the flat, circular, slightly raised area that forms around the site of an antigenic challenge to the skin.
